mods.abstract: $100 REWARD. 50 dollars will be paid to whoever will lodge, in any of the city prisons, either of the following slaves, belonging to the New Orleans and Nashville Rail Road Company. ELLICK, black, about 28 years old, 5 feet 10 inches in height, has and impediment in his speech, short hair and down cast look when spoken to. RIPLEY, griffe, about 25 years old, 5 feet 6 inches in height, rather a surly look and intelligent countenance. J H CALDWELL, President N. B. Any person or persons found harboring or employing said negroes, will be punished with the greatest severity of the law. 2w n14
mods.note: New Orleans and Nashville Rail road Company
mods.accessCondition: Please submit an LSU Special Collections reference ticket at https://askus.lib.lsu.edu/special for any questions or comments about this digital object.

Physical rights are retained by the LSU Libraries. Copyright has expired and the item is therefore in the public domain. Permission to reproduce this image must be requested through the Special Collections Department, Louisiana State University Libraries.
mods.note: Louisiana Runaway Slave Advertisements, 1836-1865, Louisiana Digital Library, Baton Rouge, La.
